intro: Diplycosia pauciseta, commonly known as the few-bracted diplycosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, with four petals and numerous stamens. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Diplycosia pauciseta is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
